column4: Hi, everyone. How can I stop my laptop screen from turning white and freaking out between the splash screen and the GNOME login? Thanks!
could be hardware problem
It's a brand new Presario laptop. I actually had the same thing happen on an Acer.
? ok.. which version of ubuntu did you installed?
Ubuntu 7.04
It totally took over the screen until I added "vga=792" to the boot options on the advice of a blog.
feisty .. is there anything in log files that might give you a hint? dmesg, messages, Xorg.0.log?
yea. that is good. it should help, but you said it does not completely resolved.
How do I check those log files?
/var/log
Here's what's in Xorg.0.log http://pastebin.com/m7ed9e072
a bit ... try to turn off aiglx .. and i am not familiar with nvidia like i am with ati
look for (EE) lines; that is usually a hint :-)
In what file should I look for the EE line? The one I just posted?
as i understand from others and forums, nvidia is usually a good driver compared to nv
yeah, the one you posted.
There are no EE entries. I'll try the restricted driver, then. brb
no more white screen?
Nope! nvidia-glx-new did it.
awesome! now you can enjoy it without an annoying problem that occupied your mind past few days. :-)
Yes, until I find something else to mess up
